body: So I'm not quite sure if everyone wants me to implement the replacement in this PR, or if it's fine for it to be a two step process?  :ear:

What parts do you implement in this PR? I imagine this going in a few steps:
1. Enable outputs to popup.
2. Remove old pager and start to redirect pager payloads to regular output

We will have to figure out how this will integrate with the output iframing and also things like output scrolling/collapse.
Neither, this simply removes the pager and leaves nothing in it's place.

I am for this, but I am not sure others will buy into it...without a
replacement...

> We will have to figure out how this will integrate with the output iframing and also things like output scrolling/collapse.

I think it will need to be in it's own frame, so we can "pop it out" (move it to a moveable/dockable modal)

> I am for this, but I am not sure others will buy into it...without a
> replacement...

Ok, should the replacement sit in between the widget area and the code cell when docked?  Seems like keeping it close to the code would be important.
This PR now offers an alternative to the pager.  The would-be pager content is routed directly to the output area.  The output area can be undocked.
The last commit (removing the layout manager) breaks things...  Working on a fix.
Bugs fixed, needs testing.  Haven't tested on FF yet.
... nothing feels good like a net removal of 212 lines of code + a new feature :wink:

@Carreau when you have some free time do you want to give this pager replacement a test and see if it works for you?  Currently the would-be pager output is redirected to the output, and the output can be undocked.

Fernando and I talked on Sunday about this a bit more. With this change,
the pager-as-output and tooltip are more similar. What about replacing the
tooltip with output that is already popped out and located in the right
place?

The entire output popped out?  Else, I'll need to change the behavior so just the pager content can be popped out, which will break the nice support for multiple mime types, or require some re-engineering out the output stuff.  Is this what you were thinking of?  I'm willing to try it, but it will take a while to implement it that way.

Hmmm, don't know, let's try it with the entire output popped out? The other
option is to dramatically simplify the tooltip to only display the function
signature with a single mode and then put things into the regular output.

## 

Brian E. Granger
Cal Poly State University, San Luis Obispo
@ellisonbg on Twitter and GitHub
bgranger@calpoly.edu and ellisonbg@gmail.com

I'm having troubles seeing how popping out the entire output, especially when you have lots of old output already, wouldn't be annoying for the shift+tab behavior.  I like the second option though...  I think I'll try that.

From a phone discussion with @ellisonbg : 
In a separate PR I'll investigate simplifying the toolbar to a single mode.
This completely break the login page for me. I am unable to login. I think removeing `ipython-main-app` was a bad idea.
Got weird stuff, creating a new cell above have now the "collapsed state" for the output.
I felt like having the tooltip as a pop-up output would be annoying a nice thing with the tooltip is that it dismisses when you type.
detached output float on top of headers and menu, feel weird.

Exciting!
- If the output area is longer than the window height, we should put it into scrolling mode when it is popped out.
- Right now the popouts scroll with the notebook page. They should be positioned relative to the window.
- When a popout is popped out for the first time, it should have a position that is almost exactly the same as it was before. IOW, users should be able to see the output in the same place and that the output belongs to that cell.....then they can move it around.
- Deleting a cell should delete the output, even if it is popped out.
- I got it into a weird mode where an empty code cell had a collapsed output button across the bottom when it was created.
- When a cell's type is changed away from code, all output should be deleted. This and the cell delete issue above, make me think we need a uniform API that triggers output deletion that includes popped output.
- Outputs snap nicely to the side of the page. Can we make outputs snap nicely to each other as well to make it easy to create an arrangement of outputs?
- If an output is really long and in scrolling mode, when you pop it out, the scrolling goes away.
- The way the initial width of the popout is set is a bit wonky. Sometimes they shrink to the content, other times wide (pop out a scrolled output).
- The un-pop (down arrow) button of a popped output is set at the top of the container. This means if the output container scrolls, that button disappears as it is scrolled out of view. It should use a different CSS position so it remains visible no matter how the output is scrolled.
I think this is a huge improvement over the old pager. I really like seeing pager text as output.
In the final mode of the tooltip, when it is sent to the pager-as-output, it should probably clear any old output before the pager content is put there.

@jdfreder can you sketch (on paper or whiteboard) the main divs we now have in our main template and the dashboard and notebook page as nested rectangles. That is one of the main things we need to review and it will be helpful to see a visual rep of those.
I think the popout arrow should only be visible if a cell is selected. Otherwise a notebook UI has a ton of those showing. Probably same with the widget area close button.
Hovering over the arrow should display a tooltip saying what it does.

> In the final mode of the tooltip, when it is sent to the pager-as-output, it should probably clear any old output before the pager content is put there.

Isn't that a little dangerous, since the user could unintentionally delete output?  Especially when we fix the tooltip so it's only one mode.

I guess it is dangerous if the user accidentally does this. Might need more
thought then.

## 

Brian E. Granger
Cal Poly State University, San Luis Obispo
@ellisonbg on Twitter and GitHub
bgranger@calpoly.edu and ellisonbg@gmail.com

Now that I have been teaching with the notebook for a couple of weeks now, and I think I understand what you are referring to when you say "pager", I'd like to make a couple of points, and ask a question.

When teaching with the notebook, it is often necessary to keep the relevant part of the notebook on the top portion of the projected screen (so those further back can see it). One can make the browser window smaller, so that it only takes up the top portion of the screen.

One can use the "pager" area (I presume that this is the area that display ?help and ??help). If so, this area is useful to put relevant, but not critical, information, and it moves the notebook portion up. For example, I have been using it to put notes, or lecture overview... something like what you would see in Powerpoint notes---except everyone can see them.

So, is this area that this PR is removing? Will there be a replacement for this area? Perhaps it can be created and manipulated through CSS, Javascript, and some custom magic, if so? It would be nice if this area (and maybe other areas---rightcolumn, leftcolumn) could be defined and manipulated with metacommands.
